pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:0.5: 65. The training rule on less than twenty years old
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.2: At that time in Rājagaha there was a group of seventeen boys who were friends,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.3: with the boy Upāli as their leader.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.5: “How can we ensure that Upāli is able to live happily without exhausting himself after we’ve passed away?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.9: but then his fingers will hurt.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.10: Or he could become an accountant,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.12: but then his chest will hurt.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.13: Or he could become a money changer,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.15: but then his eyes will hurt.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.16: But these Sakyan ascetics have pleasant habits and a happy life. After eating nice food, they sleep in beds sheltered from the wind.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.17: If Upāli goes forth with them, he’ll be able to live happily without exhausting himself after we’ve passed away.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.18: Upāli overheard this conversation between his parents.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.19: He then went to the other boys and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.20: “Come, let’s go forth with the Sakyan ascetics.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.21: “If you go forth, so will we.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.22: And the boys went each to his own parents and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.23: “Please allow me to go forth from home to homelessness.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.25: Since the parents knew that the boys all had the same desire and good intention, they gave their approval.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.26: The boys then went to the monks and asked for the going forth.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.27: And the monks gave them both the going forth and the full ordination.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.28: Soon afterwards they got up early in the morning and cried,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.29: “Give us rice porridge, give a meal, give non-staples.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.32: If any of those things becomes available, you’ll be able to have it.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.35: If not, you’ll have to wait until you’ve walked for alms.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.36: But they carried on as before.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.38: And they defecated and urinated on the furniture.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.39: After rising early in the morning, the Buddha heard the sound of those boys.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.40: He asked Venerable Ānanda what was going on,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.43: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.44: “Is it true, monks, that monks give the full ordination to people they know are less than twenty years old?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.47: “… How can those foolish men do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.48: A person who is less than twenty years old is unable to endure cold and heat; hunger and thirst; horseflies, mosquitoes, wind, and the burning sun; creeping animals and insects; and rude and unwelcome speech. And they are unable to bear up with bodily feelings that are painful, severe, sharp, and destructive of life.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.49: But a person who’s twenty years old is able to endure these things.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.51: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.52: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:1.53.1: ‘If a monk gives the full ordination to a person he knows is less than twenty years old, he commits an offense entailing confession. Moreover, that person has not received the full ordination and those monks are blameworthy.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.6: he knows by himself or others have told him or the candidate has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.8: who has not reached twenty years.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.9: If, intending to give the full ordination, he searches for a group, a teacher, a bowl, or a robe, or he establishes a monastic boundary, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.10: After the motion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.11: After each of the first two announcements, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.12: When the last announcement is finished, the preceptor commits an offense entailing confession,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.1.13: while the group and the teacher commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.1: If the other person is less than twenty years old, and he perceives them as less, and he gives them the full ordination, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.2: If the other person is less than twenty years old, but he is unsure of it, and he gives them the full ordination, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.3: If the other person is less than twenty years old, but he perceives them as more, and he gives them the full ordination, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.4: If the other person is more than twenty years old, but he perceives them as less, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.5: If the other person is more than twenty years old, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.2.6: If the other person is more than twenty years old, and he perceives them as more, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.2: if he gives the full ordination to someone less than twenty years old, but he perceives them as more than twenty;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.3: if he gives the full ordination to someone more than twenty years old, and he perceives them as more than twenty;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.5: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc65:2.3.6: The fifth rule, the training rule on less than twenty years old, is finished.
